definition: to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: Advocate cornered, so heart a horizontal, allow to stay.
sentences.chinese: 雅乐走投无路，于是把心一横，容许留下。

sentences.english: Pure literature in this era of almost no way out, still cling to.
sentences.chinese: 在这个纯文学几乎已经走投无路的年代，仍然固守。

sentences.english: Veterans of the war were desperate for relief.
sentences.chinese: 一战老兵们走投无路，急需救济。

sentences.english: Revolutionary forces have fought Gadhafi's men street by street, cornering the last vestiges of the old regime to that last district.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲旧政权的残存势力也在这个城市最终走投无路。

sentences.english: We must not make him desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我们千万不要弄得他走投无路。

sentences.english: Oh, you and I dancing slow, and we got nowhere to go.
sentences.chinese: 哦，你和我缓慢的舞动着，我们走投无路。

sentences.english: Very often the bandits are hard pressed by gendarmes or carbineers;
sentences.chinese: 强盗常常让宪兵和马枪兵逼得走投无路。

sentences.english: Pumas will not attack a human being unless it is cornered.
sentences.chinese: 美洲狮除非被逼得走投无路，是绝不会伤人的。

sentences.english: The remainder, referred to as displaced persons, or DPs, were people who literally had no place to go.
sentences.chinese: 其余被称为流离失所的人是那些完全走投无路的难民。

sentences.english: They had to escape to the home of Chiron.
sentences.chinese: 人马族被逼的走投无路，只好逃到了奇伦的家中。

sentences.english: He saw no way of eluding Featherstone's stupid demand.
sentences.chinese: 费瑟斯通的愚蠢要求使他走投无路。

sentences.english: If you're desperate for money, what are some things you can do to make money fast?
sentences.chinese: 如果你缺钱到走投无路的地步，怎样才能赚点快钱呢？

sentences.english: Mr Jones is a good chess player, and he soon had me beat coming and going.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯先生是个象棋高手，他一下子攻得我走投无路。

sentences.english: They were desperate people in a place where it hadn't rained.
sentences.chinese: 天已经好久不下雨了，他们被逼得走投无路。

definition: lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
lit. there is no road to the sky, nor door into the earth (idiom)/fig. to be at the end of one's rope/to be trapped in a hopeless situation
pinyin: shang4 tian1 wu2 lu4 , ru4 di4 wu2 men2

definition: to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
desperate straits
penniless (idiom)
to have no way out/to have no alternative
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
impossible to make a living
isolated and without help
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
to press for payment of debts/to dun
